derivation.yuyuan_name: early 17th cent.: from Greek diagnōstikos 'able to distinguish', from diagignōskein 'distinguish'; the noun from hē diagnōstikē teknē 'the art of distinguishing (disease')

entry.def: Diagnostic equipment, methods, or systems are used for discovering what is wrong with people who are ill or with things that do not work properly.

means.word_mean: 1. concerned with diagnosis; used for furthering diagnosis;
2. characteristic or indicative of e.g. a disease;
